intro: Spermacoce neodiffusa, commonly known as the Brazilian morning glory, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to South America and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant produces small, spherical berries that contain the seeds, which are often dispersed by animals. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. Spermacoce neodiffusa is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive flowers and vigorous growth.
